tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage¶

class tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage(chunks: Optional[Dict[str, int]] = None, synchronizer: Optional[Literal[process, thread]] = None, process_synchronizer_path: str = '', mapper_synchronizer: Optional[tensordb.storages.lock.BaseMapLock] = None, **kwargs)¶
__init__(chunks: Optional[Dict[str, int]] = None, synchronizer: Optional[Literal[process, thread]] = None, process_synchronizer_path: str = '', mapper_synchronizer: Optional[tensordb.storages.lock.BaseMapLock] = None, **kwargs)¶

Methods

__init__([chunks, synchronizer, …])

append(new_data[, compute, remote])

Append data at the end of a Zarr file (in case that the file does not exist it will call the store method), internally it calls the to_zarr method for every dimension of your data.

backup([force_backup])

Store the changes that you have done in your local path in the backup, it avoid overwrite unmodified chunks based in the checksum stored.

close(**kwargs)

Close the storage (Zarr does not need this but it will call the backup method automatically)

delete_tensor([only_local])

Delete the tensor

download_files(paths)

exist(on_local)

Indicate if the tensor exist or not

find_affected_chunks_names(…[, prefix])

find_affected_positions(x, y)

get_attrs([remote])

Read the metadata of a tensor stored using the set_attrs method

get_chunks_size(path[, remote])

get_dims([remote])

get_modified_files(new_data[, remote, act_data])

get_path_map(remote)

is_local_store()

is_updated()

read([remote])

Read a tensor stored, internally it use open_zarr method.

remove_files(path_map, path[, recursive])

requiere_local_update([remote])

set_attrs([remote])

This is equivalent to use the .attrs of Xarray, so basically is used to add metadata to the tensors, these are writed in .zattrs file in json format

store(new_data[, compute, remote])

Store the data, the dtype and all the details will depend of what you pass in the new_data parameter, internally this method calls the to_zarr method with a ‘w’ mode using that data.

update(new_data[, remote, compute, …])

Replace data on an existing Zarr files based on the new_data, internally calls the to_zarr method using the region parameter, so it automatically create this region based on your new_data, in some cases it could even replace all the data in the file even if you only has two coords in your new_data this happend due that Xarray only allows to write in contigous blocks (region) (read carefully how the region parameter works in Xarray)

update_backup_metadata(modified_files, remote)

update_from_backup([force_update])

Update the data in your local path using the data in the backup, it will only update the chunks that has a different checksum.

upload_files(paths)

upsert(new_data, **kwargs)

Calls the update and then the append method

Attributes

backup_map

backup_paths

local_map

metadata_extensions

Storage created for the Zarr files which implement the necessary methods to be used for TensorClient.

path
